title: Calories in Sliced Bacon
meta_description: Discover calories in sliced bacon per slice, including fat, protein, sodium, and full nutrition breakdown for easy tracking.
assumptions: Cooked pork bacon, pan-fried until crisp; one slice ≈8 g; no added seasonings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, thickness, cooking method, and fat content. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One slice of cooked sliced bacon has about 43 kcal and 3 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Add 1 tsp maple syrup glaze per slice

faqs.q: How many calories in one slice of bacon?
faqs.a: About 43 kcal for one cooked slice of pork bacon.

faqs.q: Is sliced bacon high in sodium?
faqs.a: Yes, one slice has ≈192 mg sodium, so watch intake if on a low-sodium diet.

faqs.q: What's the fat content in sliced bacon?
faqs.a: ≈3.3 g total fat per slice, with 1.1 g saturated.

faqs.q: Does cooking method affect calories in sliced bacon?
faqs.a: Pan-frying adds minimal oil, but deep-frying increases calories significantly.

faqs.q: How does turkey bacon compare in calories?
faqs.a: Turkey bacon has fewer calories (≈28 kcal per slice) and less fat than pork.
